cab.content: From Viceroy, Foreign Department, [)th July 1919. (Ideceived 2 p.hi.)1003 S. Your telegram of 7th July. Afghanistan. Letter to Amir was despatched yesterday amended as directed. To be on the safe side date of arrival of delegates was changed to 10 am., 22nd July.Last night communique gave gist ol: Amir's letter, including his complaint of one-sidedness of armistice and advice that we should withdraw troops from Dakka and Spin Baldak and stop aeroplaning. In resume of our reply emphasis is laid on Amir's apparent failure to appreciate his true position as, therein, lies explanation of one-sidedness of armistice and our insistence on it. Date fixed for arrival of Afghan delegates is given with composition of British delegation.
